data.title: Do Possums Have Rabies?
data.meta_description: Possum, if you’re in Texas, but you can call it an opossum if you like. I’ve become fascinated with this common but misunderstood animal. This week, I was at our local library with my grandson to…
data.text:
Possum, if you’re in Texas, but you can call it an opossum if you like. I’ve become fascinated with this common but misunderstood animal.

This week, I was at our local library with my grandson to view an educational program, Wildlife on the Move: Bringing Science to Life. Mr. B., cares for rescued wildlife and relinquished exotic pets and impressed us all with his passionate and interesting presentation.

Among the animals is a gentle female opossum named Lacey.

He introduced her and asked the children, “Who knows what is a possum’s favorite food is?”

A young girl bounced up and down, waving her arm until Mr. B. called on her. “I know. It’s cat food!” she said.

And that’s about all most of us who live in the range of opossums know—don’t leave the cat food out at night. In fact, as we were walking up to the library, we were wondering if the tame possum would have had its rabies shot.

Like most people, I thought opossums were common carriers of rabies. But, we all learned a lot from Mr. P…
